spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall room layout matches (Living/Dining left, Kitchen top-left, Utility top-right, Toilet mid-right, Bedroom bottom-right, Balcony bottom-left). However, window depiction/placement differs: the Living/Dining left wall window present in the plan is not clearly represented in the render (E1/E2), and the Utility/right-side glazing is rendered as large blue window panels that do not match the plan’s simpler openings (E2). Minor door swing/orientation inconsistencies are visible around Toilet-1/Bedroom entry compared to the plan arcs (E3).

structural_fidelity.notes: Adjacency relationships are largely correct (Kitchen-Utility-Toilet stack on right; Bedroom below Toilet; Balcony off Living). No major rooms missing. Notable fidelity issues: wall thickness representation changes substantially (thick black perimeter/interior walls in plan vs thin uniform gray walls in render), which alters perceived structural hierarchy (E4). Door embeddings/leaf thickness and exact jamb positions are simplified, and Toilet/Bedroom door detailing does not consistently match the plan (E2/E3). Render introduces oversized window-wall elements on the right/utility edge beyond what the plan indicates (E5).

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture types and general locations align (sofa/coffee table in Living, round dining table, bed in Bedroom, fixtures in Toilet, washer in Utility). Minor scale/spacing differences exist (e.g., bedroom circulation around bed/wardrobe band appears slightly altered by wall thickness changes) (E4).

aesthetic_quality.notes: The provided '3D isometric' render is effectively a top-down 2D/orthographic-style visualization rather than an isometric 3D view (E6). Lighting/shading is minimal and does not convey 3D depth. Geometry is clean and readable, but overall fails the isometric camera requirement and has overly stylized window coloring that reduces plan-faithful clarity.

detected_errors.description: Utility/top-right and right-side openings are rendered as large blue window panels that do not match the plan’s window/opening representation and apparent size.
Living/Dining left wall window shown in the plan is not clearly present/legible in the render.
Door swing/orientation around Toilet-1 (and potentially Bedroom entry) appears inconsistent with the plan’s door arc placement.
Wall thickness hierarchy is not preserved (plan shows thick structural/perimeter walls; render uses thin uniform walls), altering perceived proportions and structural intent.
Oversized/extra-stylized glazing elements on the right side (utility/shaft edge) read as added features beyond what is explicitly indicated in the 2D plan.
Render is not isometric 3D; it is a top-down 2D-like visualization, failing the intended camera/projection requirement.
